page.title: 04The Avenue,Snape,Yorkshire.
page.content: The Avenue is the main exit and entrance to Snape.It is a straight road with a view of Snape Castle at the end.There are 35 lime trees on either side which were planted in 1721.In Spring and Summer many flowers grow in between the trees.They are snowdrops,crocuses,daffodils,grape hyacinths and bluebells.It is a ten minute walk from one end of the Avenue to the other.There are two seats for those wishing to have a rest on the way.On the other side of the Avenue there are crop fields and a field where cows and sheep graze.
